Sentencas: This paper presents an analysis of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system integrated with an ethanol reforming process.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: The recycling of the anode exhaust gas in the integrated SOFC system is considered to improve its performance.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: The results indicate that under the same operating conditions, the SOFC system operated with the recycle of the anode exhaust gas has higher electrical and thermal efficiencies than a non-recycling SOFC system.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: The required conditions to prevent carbon formation in the ethanol reformer are also examined.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: When the SOFC system with anode exhaust gas recycling is operated at a higher recirculation ratio and fuel utilization, the carbon formation can be reduced, which in turn decreases the reformer operating temperature.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: However, the recirculation ratio has to be carefully selected because an increase in the recirculation ratio has an adverse impact on the electrical efficiency of the SOFC system.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: In addition, the results show that the electrical efficiency depends on the fuel utilization of the SOFC.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: At low fuel utilization (0.5-0.6), the electrical efficiency increases as the recirculation ratio increases.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation

Sentencas: In contrast, when the SOFC is operated at a higher fuel utilization (>0.6), an increase in the recirculation ratio results in a decrease in the electrical efficiency.
Titulo: Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation
Analysis of an ethanol-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell system using partial anode exhaust gas recirculation
